alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 5:03PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Martin, northeastern Floyd and northwestern Pike Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 502 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Justell, or 9 miles northwest of Pikeville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Coal Run around 505 PM EDT. Pikeville, Coal Run Village, McCombs and Endicott around 510 PM EDT. Gulnare around 515 PM EDT. Piso, Jarad, Heenan and Meta around 520 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Varney, Threeforks, Moree, Heisey, Conder, Sidney, Laura, Rural, Hatfield Station, Canada, Forest Hills, Turkey Creek, Whitepost, Belfry, Hardy and Huddy. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 6 and 24. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 9. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 27 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
